title: The usurpations of France upon the trade of the woollen manufacture of England briefly hinted at, being the effects of thirty years observations, by which that King hath been enabled to wage war with so great a part of Europe, or, A caution to England to improve a season now put into her hand, to secure her self by William Carter.
author: Carter, W. (William)
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for Richard Baldwin at the Oxford-Armes in Warwick-Lane, and Joseph Fox at the Cap in Westminster-Hall,
